title: Ticket #4757: Let user know when scheduler or local universe job limits are hit
description:
BMRB just ran into an issue where scheduler universe jobs weren't starting because 

  StartSchedulerUniverse = TotalSchedulerJobsRunning < 200

and 

  TotalSchedulerJobsRunning = 200

The problem is, it is really hard for the user to figure this out. The jobs just stay idle; there's nothing in the job user log or even the SchedLog that indicates that you hit this limit, and, of course, you can't use condor_q -analyze to figure out what's going on.

I can see a number of possible things to do (kind of in order of increasing work):

  1. Print something in the SchedLog when jobs don't start because of this limit.
  2. Put this information in some event in the job's user log, if it has one.
  3. Print this information when you do condor_q -analyze on a scheduler or local universe job.
  4. Print a warning when you submit a scheduler or local universe job, and the schedd has hit (or is close to) one of these limits.

One other bizarre symptom: this apparently causes newly-submitted scheduler universe jobs, at least, to not appear at all in the SchedLog.
